unnormalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! The entertainment world is buzzing with film festival fever! From Cannes to Kolkata, filmmakers and cinephiles are gearing up for a season of screenings, workshops, and star-studded events.
normalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! The entertainment world is buzzing with film festival fever! From Cannes to Kolkata, filmmakers and cinephiles are gearing up for a season of screenings, workshops, and star studded events. Word on the street is that several promising Indian indie films are making waves on the international circuit. Keep an eye out for features exploring themes of social justice and family dynamics — real stories that resonate. Back home, preparations are in full swing for the Chennai International Film Festival, scheduled for December. Expect a delicious spread of regional and international cinema, plus plenty of piping hot biryani stalls to keep you fueled throughout the day! Speaking of regional cinema, the Kerala State Film Awards just wrapped up, celebrating the best of Malayalam film. And with Onam just around the corner, expect more film related celebrations to follow! Film festivals aren't just about glamour, they're about discovering new voices and perspectives. So grab your popcorn, support independent cinema, and let the magic unfold! rupees two hundred for a ticket well spent, wouldn't you agree?

unnormalised: Word on the street is that several promising Indian indie films are making waves on the international circuit. Keep an eye out for features exploring themes of social justice and family dynamics – real stories that resonate.

Back home, preparations are in full swing for the Chennai International Film Festival, scheduled for December. Expect a delicious spread of regional and international cinema, plus plenty of piping hot biryani stalls to keep you fueled throughout the day!

Speaking of regional cinema, the Kerala State Film Awards just wrapped up, celebrating the best of Malayalam film. And with Onam just around the corner, expect more film-related celebrations to follow!

Film festivals aren't just about glamour, they're about discovering new voices and perspectives. So grab your popcorn, support independent cinema, and let the magic unfold! Rs. 200 for a ticket well spent, wouldn't you agree?
